required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trail of Acupuncture and Liu-Zi-Jue Exercise for Dysphagia in Post-stroke
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Trail of Acupuncture and Liu-Zi-Jue Exercise for Dysphagia in Post-stroke

lead_sponsor.agency: The Third Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

clinical_study.source: The Third Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The traditional Chinese medicine rehabilitation for post-stroke dysphagia impairment will be intervened, which can promote the recovery of dysphagia function of stroke patients, reduce the disability rate and improve the quality of life.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will collect inpatients from April 2020 to December 2022 who from the third affiliated hospital of Zhejiang university of traditional Chinese medicine, Jiaxing hospital of traditional Chinese medicine, Hangzhou hospital of traditional Chinese medicine.this study sets strict time window (stroke recovery, 30-180 days), use multi-center, large sample, randomized controlled study method and the objective recognition rehabilitation evaluation criteria and efficacy evaluation system to evaluate the clinical effect and analysis of health economics.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Standardized Swallowing Assessment at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: use Standardized Swallowing Assessment to evaluate the patient's conscious, lip closure control ability, the head and trunk control ability, the respiratory mode.

secondary_outcome.measure: video fluoroscopic swallowing study score，VFSS score
secondary_outcome.description: Mainly includes oral stage, pharynx stage, the degree of pharynx three parts, oral stage for 0-2 points; The pharyngeal period was 0-3 points; The degree of pharynx error is 0-4 points, with a total score of 9 points for the sum of the three points. The higher the score, the better the swallowing function is.

secondary_outcome.measure: The effective rate of swallowing function treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 0 week, 4 weeks, 8 weeks and 16 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The effective rate was calculated according to the score of the standard swallowing function evaluation,scale, and the effective criterion was as follows: the patient's score increased by more than 30% > compared with that before treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time required for swallowing to improve
secondary_outcome.description: it will be assessed by Water Swallow Test (WST),this test divided into 1 ~ 5 levels. The higher level means less dysphagia

arm_group.description: basic treatment+Swallowing rehabilitation training+Chinese traditional rehabilitation

intervention.description: Chinese traditional rehabilitation including acupuncture and Gongfa

overall_official.affiliation: The Third Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

facility.name: The Third Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University
Hangzhou hospital of traditional Chinese medicine
Jiaxing hospital of Chinese traditional medicine

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The Third Affiliated hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University
